results.title: Dressing up in the past
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Presents Lorri Baines, National Gallery Education Officer, demonstrating what the gallery offers children in terms of the history of clothing and costume. Using two children as models she shows how eighteen century aristocrats would have dressed and the restrictions imposed by their mode of dress.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: An Introduction to Aussie sports
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok and Australian Sports Commission
results.brief_description: Max Walker, ex-Australian cricketer, introduces an educational program designed to encourage greater on-going participation in sports by children. Outlines modified team games such as Softcrosse, modified hockey, mini-soccer and T-Ball. Describes the awards scheme for four Aussie Sports and makes reference to the resource manual accompanying the sports.
results.description: Max Walker, ex-Australian cricketer, introduces an educational program designed to encourage greater on-going participation in sports by children. results.title: Integration: a place for everyone
results.brief_description: Presents an overview of the integration process at work. Indicates parents’ desires for their disabled children at school. Stresses necessity of support group between school and family and classroom modifications for successful integration. Highlights educational and social benefits for the dissabled child.
results.description: Presents an overview of the integration process at work. Indicates parents’ desires for their disabled children at school. results.title: Working together
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Outlines ways in which parents can become actively involved in the running of their local school. Shows how at various schools throughout the state parents are helping with children’s reading, writing, mathematics, typing, school displays and review of school policy.

results.title: A Woman's place ... is on the school council
results.creator_credit: Warren Thomas and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A program designed to encourage women to become members of their school council. Emphasises the need for effective communication and how to overcome barriers to communication.

results.title: By design?
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Provides a behind the scene look at the world of fashion. People from Cherry Lane fashion house, “Dolly” and “Mode” magazines and the Australian Wool corporation talk about what is involved in predicting fashions trends, designing, producing garments and putting together fashion.

results.title: Power train
results.creator_credit: Teru Murakami, George Dunning, Films/West and Industrial Animation Films
results.brief_description: This animated program explains the workings of the automotive transmission system. Reveals the need for and the mechanics of each major component: clutch, gearbox, universal joint, drive shaft and differential.

results.title: Wir Stellen Uns Vor
results.brief_description: Designed for students of elementary German. Consists of three self contained documentary film sequences showing young Germans using simple language in authentic exchanges from their everyday lives.
